uses a single chain figure 8 a common method for fastening off when you complete your last stitch you will make a single chain on top of that stitch and then cut the yarn 2-3 inches away from the hook then use the hook to pull that final loop until the cut end is pulled all the way out leaving a loose end pull the end tight to create a knot this will leave enough length left over to thread onto a tapestry needle and weave in the end note some patterns will tell you to leave a much longer end sometimes a few feet long this is mostly used in amigurumi plushie making where the loose ends are used
